item.title: Accessing SQL Server from OS X
item.description: Every once in a while I need to access a Microsoft SQL Server database from my Mac, usually to create a data migration script. In the past I used a commercial ODBC driver. But ODBC on OS X was deprecated ages ago. In this post, I’ll talk about my current stack for accessing SQL Server databases via Ruby and Python and how to set it up. Note that I do not use homebrew, so these are all native installs.
